contentrichtext.text: '''Pala''' may refer to: {{TOCright}} ==Places== ;American Samoa *[[Pala Lake]], protected wetland on Aunu'u, American Samoa ;Chad *[[Pala, Chad]], a town in Chad ;East Timor *[[Pala (East Timor)]], a town on [[Atauro Island]], East Timor ;Estonia: *[[Pala Parish]], a municipality in Jõgeva County *[[Pala, Jõgeva County]], a village in [[Pala Parish]], Jõgeva County *[[Pala, Kõue Parish]], a village in Kõue Parish, Harju County *[[Pala, Kuusalu Parish]], a village in Kuusalu Parish, Harju County *[[Pala, Järva County]], a village in Türi Parish, Järva County ;India *Pala (or [[Palai]]), a town in Kerala, India *[[Pala Empire]], an empire of ancient Bengal on the Indian subcontinent ;Turkey *Pala, a region in Anatolia during the Bronze Age which spoke the [[Palaic language]]; it was to the northwest of Hattusa on the other side of Mount Asharpaya ;United States *[[Pala, California]], a town in the United States *[[Pala Casino Resort and Spa]], a casino located in Pala, California ==Other uses== *[[Pala (album)]] is the second album from [[Friendly Fires]] released in 2011. * [[Pala (sword)]], a shorter kind of Turkish sword or [[kilij]] * Pala, a fictional island in [[Island (novel)|''Island'' (novel)]], by Aldous Huxley * Pala, an Italian word meaning 'shovel, paddle, blade'; in art, it can mean an [[altarpiece]] (''pala d'altare'') * Pala, in Sanskrit, a term meaning 'protector'. Can refer to a form of [[wrathful deity]], in Buddhism * Pala, a folk-theatre form, native to Odisha, akin to [[Jatra (Bengal)|jatra]] of Bengal * Pala, a fictional town in [[Far Cry 2]] * PALA, the [[Labor and Agrarian Party]] of Panama (''Partido Laborista Agrario'') * PALA, [[Polish American Librarians Association (PALA)]] *[[Presidential Active Lifestyle Award]], American fitness promotion program * PALA (Song) is a song from the album Landscape:Zero by Vinyl Mind released in 2009. {{disambig}}
